alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 8:36PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hendricks and southwestern Marion Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 835 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plainfield, or 11 miles southwest of Indianapolis, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will impact the southwest Indianapolis metro area, including the following locations... Indianapolis Int`l Airport, Camby, Avon and Homecroft. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 108 and 110. Interstate 70 between mile markers 63 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
